subject: Standard Operating Procedure for Monitoring of payment of remittance made by User Fee Collection Agencies - reg.
text: HRaly 7574 TTHRf qifeabrut (4335 4ae 3r RoTHTf TA, 4RG TaFR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Fn4 Tra 1l-5 Qdi 6, 4az7-10, Z1w51, 7} @oft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 THA/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Management of Plazas/2022 Policy Circular No.17.5.84/ 2022 dated 22nd November, 2022 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/HQ/CO-Division / Policy decision/2022 (Comp. No. 157797)} Sub:: Standard Operating Procedure for Monitoring of payment of remittance made by User Fee Collection Agencies reg: Instructions were issued to all ROs/ PDs vide office order NHAI/13013/20- 21/CO/Policy Matter-Part(1)/E/21135/1 dated 31st July 2020 regarding Zero tolerance to default in remittance payment by User Fee Collection Agencies/Contractors 2 , In spite of above clear instructions, some serious cases of default in remittance payments have been noticed recently wherein the default including penalties exceeded the amount of performance security available with NHAI. Such lapses on part of PDs and ROs have been taken seriously by the Competent Authority warranting disciplinary action against the defaulting officials 3. To avoid such instances in future, following instructions are issued which may be strictly complied with: 3.1 FGA Unit at RO office will monitor the remittances being deposited by user fee collection agencies on daily basis and submit report to concerned ROs and PDs bringing out the default in payment of agreed remittance by any Agency/Contractor, if 3.2 PD will take following action as and when any report of default in remittance is reported by FGA Unit: (a) Regular Contracts (One year Contracts); As per clause 19(i) of RFP/Contract, in case of any default of the user fee agency in payment of weekly instalment of the agreed remittance as per due date, the Contractor /Fee Collection Agency is required to pay the dues with penalty within 3 days of the due date failing which the same will be adjusted from the Cash Performance security by the Project Director and simultaneously the Project Director shall route the ETC Collection directly to NHAI Toll Account in consultation with IHMCL. Performance security shall be replenished by the contractor within next 7 from the date of such recovery. PD shall re-route the ETC collection to the account of fee collection agency, in consultation with IHMCL, after performance security is replenished within specified time by the Agency: (b) Three Months_Contracts: As per clause 19(i) of RFP /Contract, in case there is default of two instalments and the contractor does not pay the dues along with penalty, the same will be adjusted from the Cash Performance security by Project Director and simultaneously the Project Director shall route the ETC Collection directly to NHAI Toll Account in consultation with IHMCL. Performance security shall be replenished by the contractor within next 3 days from the date of such recovery. PD shall re-route the ETC collection to the account of fee collection agency, in consultation with IHMCL; after performance security is replenished within specified time by the Agency.
